title: Wheelchair Tennis Final Match
summary: Alfie Hewett and Gordon Reid are two British tennis players who use wheelchairs. They played in a big final match called the Wheelchair Masters. They tried very hard to win a fourth title, which would have been a new record. But they lost the match in a very close and exciting game. Even though they did not win, they showed great sportsmanship and effort. This story is about their journey and how they never give up, inspiring others to play sports too.

background_read: Wheelchair tennis is a sport for athletes who use wheelchairs, similar to regular tennis but with some rule changes. It is played in tournaments around the world, and players like Alfie Hewett and Gordon Reid are famous for their skills. The Wheelchair Masters is a top competition where the best players compete. Winning titles shows how good they are, and setting records inspires others with disabilities to play sports and achieve their dreams.
